entityType.description: Specifies the entity type (=interface). The data in specified interface is redistributed from API to target system(s).

subscribedService.description: Currently the subscribedService -parameter value is ignored and data is distributed to all target systems. This is likely to be enhanced in a further release to allow specifying the target system.

lastUpdated.description: Records with lastUpdated -timestamp after the specified value are redistributed. '0001-01-01' can be used as input value to redistribute all records.

externalCodes.description: Specifies an array of external codes to be redistributed. If both externalCodes and lastUpdated -filter are specified, only the externalCodes -filter is used.

listKey.description: Used when redistributing data to 'GenericList' entity types. Specifies the list key.

version.description: Specifies the API version, as in /v1/projects or /v2/projects. Default value: V1.

externalCode.description: External identifier

success.description: Identifies if the invoice was succesfully removed

responseMessage.description: Message that gives more details of the deviance that was identified in the invoice details. The message is stored to a comment field in the invoice action log item that is created based on the result.

sourceSystem.description: Indicates the system that is returning transfer response.

externalCode.description: The coding row number in the external system.

accountCode.description: Defines code for the account. If empty, defaults based on item's purchasing category.

accountName.description: Defines name for the account. If empty, defaults based on the item's purchasing category.

costCenterCode.description: Cost center code. If empty, the requisition owner's default cost center is used.

employeeCode.description: Employee code. If empty, defaults to requisition owner's employee code.

employeeName.description: Employee name. If empty, defaults to requisition owner's name.

accAssignmentCategoryCode.description: Account assignment category code. If empty, defaults based on the item's purchasing category.

accAssignmentCategoryName.description: Account assignment category name. If empty, defaults based on the item's purchasing category.

budgetCode.description: Defines a code for the budget.

dimCode1.description: DimCode1-10 are often used for additional, customer-specific, coding dimensions. Specifies the dimension code.

dimName1.description: DimName1-10 is used for additional, customer-specific, coding dimensions. Specifies the dimension name.

num1.description: Num1-5 are custom fields in the business document.

text1.description: Text1-5 are custom fields in the business document.

date1.description: Date1-5 are custom fields in the business document.

externalCode.description: External identifier that is used as a key in API for the requisition line.

extRequisitionLineNumber.description: The requisition line number in the external system. The value must be unique for each line on the requisition.

categoryCode.description:
Code for the item's purchasing category. The code must match a valid, active purchasing category for the organization. 
If invalid, the field will be emptied during import.

supplierCode.description:
A code to identify the supplier. The code must match a valid supplier for the organization, or it will be emptied during import. 
If the purchase order is a self-service order and the supplier is invalid, the import will fail.

buyerProductCode.description: A code that identifies purchased items for internal reporting and communication.

desiredDeliveryDate.description: Desired date the goods are to be delivered.

deliveryTerm.description: Identifier for the agreed delivery term for the item. If empty, supplier's delivery term is used.

allowPartialDeliveries.description: Indicates if the partial delivery of goods is allowed. If empty, defaults to false.

paymentTermCode.description:
Identifier for the agreed payment term to be used when supplier charges the customer. 
If empty, defaults to the supplier's payment term.

receiveAutomatically.description: Indicates if the goods can be automatically received by Basware P2P on behalf of the user. If empty, defaults to false.

unspsc.description:
The United Nations Standard Products and Services Code, a unique 8-digit number used to identify trade items, products, and services. 
The value can also be used to match order lines to invoice lines. If empty, resolved by Basware P2P using the item's categoryCode.

lineDataDate1.description: LineDataDate1-5 can be used for customer-specific date fields. This data will go to Line data -tab of the requisition line in P2P.

lineDataNum1.description: LineDataNum1-5 can be used for customer-specific numeric fields. This data will go to Line data -tab of the requisition line in P2P.

lineDataText1.description: LineDataText1-5 can be used for customer-specific text fields. This data will go to Line data -tab of the requisition line in P2P.

quantity.description: Defines how many items a customer wants to purchase. The quantity must contain a positive value.

priceType.description: Defines if the unit price stated is net (0) or gross (1). If empty, defaults to net (0).

unitPrice.description: Price for a single unit without discount. Price type (Net / Gross) is specified in field 'priceType'.

currencyCode.description:
A code that identifies the currency of the price on the line. All requisition lines must have the same currency code. 
If the code is different from the organization's currency, an exchange rate must exist for both codes in Basware P2P Administration, or the import will fail.

taxCode.description: Defines name for the tax code. If empty, Basware P2P resolves the value using the tax percent from the purchasing category.

taxPercent.description: Defines the tax percent. If empty, Basware P2P resolves the value using the tax percent from the purchasing category.

taxPercent2.description: Second tax percent. Used for example for handling reverse charges on EU VAT.

ownerOrderingEmail.description: Contact email to which supplier can send questions about the order. Note: When order is sent to supplier, it is not sent to this email. Note: Fields visible on the order sent to supplier are configured in P2P Purchase.

orderRecipientType.description:
Determines who order is sent to.
-Supplier(0) : Order is sent only to supplier.
-If orderingMethod is email, order is sent to the email indicated by 'supplierOrderingEmail'. -If orderingMethod is network, the order is sent through Basware network.
-Owner (1): Order is sent only to email address(es) indicated by field 'otherOrderingEmail'. Used for example when goods were picked up from a store and no order needs to be sent to supplier.
-SupplierAndOwner (2): Order is sent to both supplier and email addresses indicated by field 'otherOrderingEmail'. Order delivery method to supplier is determined by orderingMethod, same as above.

supplierOrderingEmail.description: Email address used to override the default supplier email address, when orderRecipientType is Supplier or SupplierAndOwner.

otherOrderingEmail.description: The email address(es) where the order is sent by P2P purchase. Can contain multiple email addresses separated by semicolon. The order is sent to these addresses when orderRecipientType is 'Owner' or 'Both'.

linePricingDate1.description: LinePricingDate1-5 can be used for customer-specific date fields. This data will go to Pricing -tab of the requisition line in P2P.

linePricingNum1.description: LinePricingNum1-5 can be used for customer-specific numeric fields. This data will go to Pricing -tab of the requisition line in P2P.

linePricingText1.description: LinePricingText1-5 can be used for customer-specific text fields. This data will go to Pricing -tab of the requisition line in P2P.

codingRows.description: Each requisition line can have only one coding row.

extRequisitionLineNumber.description: The requisition line number in the external system. The value must be unique for each line of the requisition.

categoryCode.description:
Code for the item's purchasing category. The code must match a valid, active purchasing category for the organization. 
If invalid, the field will be emptied during import.

supplierCode.description:
A code to identify the supplier. The code must match a valid supplier for the organization, or it will be emptied during import. 
If the purchase order is a self-service order and the supplier is invalid, the import will fail.

buyerProductCode.description: A code that identifies purchased items for internal reporting and communication.

desiredDeliveryDate.description: Desired date the goods are to be delivered.

paymentTermCode.description:
Identifier for the agreed payment term to be used when supplier charges the customer. 
If empty, defaults to the supplier's payment term.

deliveryTermCode.description: Identifier for the agreed delivery term for the item. If empty, supplier's delivery term is used.

allowPartialDeliveries.description: Indicates if the partial delivery of goods is allowed. If empty, defaults to false.

receiveAutomatically.description: Indicates if the goods can be automatically received by Basware P2P on behalf of the user. If empty, defaults to false.

unspsc.description:
The United Nations Standard Products and Services Code, a unique 8-digit number used to identify trade items, products, and services. 
The value can also be used to match order lines to invoice lines. If empty, resolved by Basware P2P using the item's categoryCode.

lineDataDate1.description: Custom field in the business document. Below custom fields go to 'Line data' -tab of the requisition line.

lineDataDate2.description: Custom field in the business document.

lineDataDate3.description: Custom field in the business document.

lineDataDate4.description: Custom field in the business document.

lineDataText5.description: Custom field in the business document.

quantity.description: Defines how many items a customer wants to purchase. At least one requisition line must contain a positive quantity value.

priceType.description: Defines if the unit price stated is net (0) or gross (1). If empty, defaults to net (0).

currencyCode.description:
A code that identifies the currency of the price on the line. All requisition lines must have the same currency code. 
If the code is different from the organization's currency, an exchange rate must exist for both codes in Basware P2P Administration, or the import will fail.

taxCode.description: Defines name for the tax code. If empty, Basware P2P resolves the value using the tax percent from the purchasing category.

taxPercent.description: Defines the tax percent. If empty, Basware P2P resolves the value using the tax percent from the purchasing category.

taxPercent2.description: Second tax percent. Used for example for handling reverse charges on EU VAT.

linePricingDate1.description: Custom field in the business document. Below custom fields go to 'Pricing' -tab of the requisition line.

linePricingText3.description: Custom field in the business document.

linePricingText4.description: Custom field in the business document.

linePricingText5.description: Custom field in the business document.

codingRows.description: Each requisition line can have only one coding row.

attachOrderPdfToXml.description: Indicates whether the order PDF will be attached to the XML order sent to the supplier.

orderOwnerEmailAddress.description: Recipient email address where order is sent when orderRecipientType is set as Owner or SupplierAndOwner.

orderRecipientType.description:
Determines who order is sent to.
-Supplier(0) : Order is sent only to supplier.
-If orderingMethod is email, order is sent to the email indicated by 'supplierOrderingEmail'. -If orderingMethod is network, the order is sent through Basware network.
-Owner (1): Order is sent only to email address(es) indicated by field 'otherOrderingEmail'. Used for example when goods were picked up from a store and no order needs to be sent to supplier.
-SupplierAndOwner (2): Order is sent to both supplier and email addresses indicated by field 'otherOrderingEmail'. Order delivery method to supplier is determined by orderingMethod, same as above.

supplierEmailAddress.description: Email address used to override the default supplier email address, when orderRecipientType is Supplier or SupplierAndOwner.

otherOrderingEmail.description: The email address(es) where the order is sent by P2P purchase. Can contain multiple email addresses separated by semicolon. The order is sent to these addresses when orderRecipientType is 'Owner' or 'Both'.

requestId.description: ID of the request on which error occurred (generated by Basware API).

hasErrors.description: Specifies whether the request has errors.

ResponseEntityList.description: Errors returned here are returned synchronously from Basware API middle layer. Additional errors coming from target system(s) may be returned through errorFeedbacks API.

code.description: TODO- Fix description- Specifies the role that is assigned to user. possible values "https://confluence.basware.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=328080739#RM1258BaswareandPartnerUserLogin-Solution". Remove p2p in front and add roles "NetworkAU" and "NetworkUS". No validation.

tenants.description: Optional tenant list for filtering access by tenant. If left empty user is granted access to all tenants he has the system level access.

requestId.description: ID of the request on which error occurred (generated by Basware API).

hasErrors.description: Specifies whether the request has errors.

externalCode.description: Coding row external code.

rowIndex.description:
Unique number assigned to a row at the time of it's creation. 
Note: Does not necessarily contain sequential numbers. May contain gaps (as in 1,2,5,6) in cases where coding lines are deleted.

lastComment.description: Last user comment related to a coding row.

matchingType.description: Order matching type(framework, return, service, standard)

grossTotal.description: Coding row gross sum, in invoice currency.

grossTotalCompany.description: Coding row gross sum, in company home currency.

grossTotalOrganization.description: Coding row gross sum, in organization currency.

netTotal.description: Coding row net sum, in invoice currency.

netTotalCompany.description: Coding row net sum, in company home currency.

netTotalOrganization.description: Coding row net sum, in organization currency.

receivedNetPrice.description: Received net unit price on (matched) goods receipt.

receivedGrossPrice.description: Received gross unit price on (matched) goods receipt.

receivedNetTotal.description: Received net total on (matched) goods receipt.

receivedGrossTotal.description: Received gross total on (matched) goods receipt.

conversionNumerator.description: Conversion numerator. Used in giving fractional unit amounts. Used with SAP.

conversionDenominator.description: Conversion denominator. Used in giving fractional unit amounts. Used with SAP.

orderNetTotal.description: Ordered net total on (matched) order line.

orderGrossTotal.description: Ordered gross total on (matched) order line.

orderedNetPrice.description: Ordered net unit price (matched) order line.

orderedGrossPrice.description: Ordered gross unit price on (matched) order line.

orderItemNumber.description: Order item number (from matched order line).

orderLineNumber.description: Order line number (from matched order line).

orderLineDescription.description: Order line description (from matched order line).

orderLinePriceUnit.description: Order line price unit (from matched order line).

orderLinePriceUnitDescription.description: Order line price unit description (from matched order line).

goodsReceiptItemNumber.description: Goods receipt item number (from matched goods receipt).

goodsReceiptNumber.description: Goods receipt number (from matched goods receipt).

orderLineUOM.description: Order line unit of measure (from matched order line).

subUOM.description: Order line sub unit of measure (from matched order line).

orderCodingRowNumber.description: Order coding row number - from coding row(s) of matched order line.

taxPercent2.description: Tax percent 2. Can be used for example for handling reverse charges on EU VAT.

taxSum.description: Coding row tax sum, in invoice currency.

taxSumCompany.description: Coding row tax sum, in company home currency.

taxSumOrganization.description: Coding row tax sum, in organization currency.

taxSum2.description: Coding row tax sum 2, in invoice currency.

taxSum2Company.description: Coding row tax sum 2, in company home currency.

taxSum2Organization.description: Coding row tax sum 2, in organization currency.

rowOrigin.description: Not in use. Reserved for indicating how coding row was created.

dimCode1.description: dimCode1-10 are often used for additional, customer-specific, coding dimensions. Specifies the dimension code.

dimName1.description: dimName1-10 are often used for additional, customer-specific, coding dimensions. Specifies the dimension name.

num1.description: Num1-5 can be used for additional, customer-specific, numeric coding fields.

text1.description: Text1-5, Text84-85 can be used for additional, customer-specific, text coding fields.

date1.description: Date1-5 can be used for additional, customer-specific, date coding fields.

applicationCode.description: P2P, Gateway, SmartMatching, Network, Reporting, Access, Sourcing

externalCode.description: Exernal code for tax calculation rule.

account.description: Tax account. Used in creating tax account posting for SAP.

statistical.description: Statistical indicator. Used in SAP business logic for balance calculations. values: 'X' or null. When X, SAP skips balance check.

transactionType.description: SAP tax transaction type. Example values: MWST, VST.

taxPercent.description: Tax percentage used for this tax calculation rule.

country.description: Country code. Example values: DE, EN.

condition.description: Condition type. Technical field required back by SAP when posting invoices. Example values: MWVS, MWAS.

companyCode.description: Defines a company code that the tax code is mapped to

inherit.description: The value specifies whether the property is inherited to lower organizations.

active.description: This flag will enable the data to be visible on UI, provided if the value is true, not visible in case of value is false. It will be also used for soft delete.

taxCodeNames.description: Defines name(s) for the tax code. Please always include 'en-US' language tag for Basware global support, as well as any local-language tag being used. If both translations are not available, please use the same string with both language tags.

taxPercentage.description: Specifies the tax percentage. The value must be 0-100.

taxPercentage2.description: Tax percentage 2 (may be used for example for partially deductible VAT)

additionalData.description: SAP tax calculation rules. Used with SAP interfaces.

companies.description: List of company units to associate taxcodes to P2P organization hierarchy

externalCode.description: External identifier that is used as a key in API.

lastUpdated.description: Timestamp when the record was last sent to API. Set automatically.

tenantCode.description: Specifies Basware Unique Tenant Id, currently basware customer id

externalCode.description: External identifier that is used as a key in API. External code of the transferResponse needs to be unique within an accountingDocument -record. You should always create a new externalCode when sending response, there is no overwriting/editing of previous response. This will enable the visibility that all responses are tracked in API. ExternalCode in response messages plays no role in P2P (other than it is used in communication between P2P and the API layer).

success.description: Specifies if the invoice was succesfully transfered to ERP system (true = invoice successfully transferred, false = transfer failed).

responseMessage.description: Informative message for P2P user regarding the transfer. If transfer failed, please indicate reason for transfer failure in this message. This message is shown in invoice action log.

sourceSystem.description: Indicates the system that is returning transfer response.

voucherNumber1.description: Available for returning voucher number from ERP system. Voucher number is saved onto the invoice in P2P.

voucherNumber2.description: Available for returning second voucher number from ERP system. Voucher number 2 is saved onto the invoice in P2P.

transferDate.description: Transfer date. Saved onto the invoice in P2P. Note: Field needs to be made visible in P2P UI to see sent value.

paymentBlock.description: Available for indicating if invoice has been set to payment blocked -state by the receiving ERP system. Saved onto the invoice in P2P.

uiLanguage.description: Language code. Specifies the language in which the user uses the system. The languages, for example English or Finnish, are available in the language picker.

countryCode.description: Specifies user's country code. Not used in P2P Alusta.

loginAccount.description: User identifier for authentication. With SSO loginAccount needs to match to the data that identity provider sends to Basware and with P2P basic authentication the loginAccount needs to match to what user keys in during authentication. For example BASWARE\john.smith or john.smith@basware.com. Basware Access basic authentication uses email instead of loginAccount. P2P and Access allow changes to loginAccount without creating a new user, but in Network Portal loginAccount is unique identifier i.e. changed loginAccount means new user into Network Portal.

middleInitial.description: Specifies the user's middle name's initial letter.

email.description: Specifies the users email address. User needs access to the email account in order to set password. Note: When loginType = 4 (Basware Access), the email is used as users login account and must be unique within a tenant. Else only the first user having the same email is accepted, next users are not created.

validFrom.description: The user is active and can use the system starting from this date.

validUntil.description: On this date, the user is deactivated and can no longer use the system.

supervisorLoginAccount.description: Unique user id of the users supervisor.

personCode.description: Defines the users person code that is mapped with the users employee ID.

loginType.description:
User 'loginType' needs to be 4 (user authentication through Basware Access) when the user is imported to any system besides (or in addition to) P2P. Following types of login are available.
Single service username and password login (0): Entry level option for cases when only one Basware service is in use. User is created to the Basware service user repository and authentication is with username and password. If more than one Basware service is in use this may cause situation where same user has different passwords for different Basware services and needs to authenticate separately to each service. Passwords are delivered via separate emails.
Single service SSO login (2): Single Sign On integrated solution for cases when only one Basware service is in use. Also used for Purchase Manager and Invoice Automation point to point authentication integration if other Basware services are not in use. Not applicable with some Basware Services (username and separate password is used in those services instead).
Basware Access login (4): Authentication through Basware Access. Authentication for cases when all Basware services are in use or when Single Sign On integration is required and not otherwise supported. Supports both username and password authentication and SSO integrations. Requires provisioning Basware Access service into use. 'Password' -field above needs to be null when using Basware Access login type.
Defined in P2P (99): Allows login type to be changed to one of the above in P2P Administration's user management module. Defaults to 'Default login type' set for the user's home organization in P2P.

accessEnabledLogin.description:
Allows user to login through Basware Access even if loginType != 4 (login through Basware Access).
Needs to be set to 'true' in cases where P2P uses a different loginType than 4 and CloudScan 3.0 or Reporting is required on the same user account.

approvalPasswordUseAllowed.description: This value defines whether the system generates an approval password for the user to be used when approving purchase requisitions, purchase orders, and invoices.

collaborationSendType.description: Defines how notifications are sent for discussions and announcements. The options are: 0 = No notifications, 1 = For each new message, 2 = Daily summary.

messageSendType.description: Defines how notifications are sent for tasks. The options are: 0 = No notifications, 1= For each new task, 2 = Daily summary.

groups.description: User groups in P2P. These determine user rights within P2P application. User groups are created and configured in P2P user group administration UI. When user group creation has been done, the groups can be assigned to users through this section of users API.

accessLoginMethod.description:
Used only when loginType = 4 (=Basware Access). Normally empty. Used when multiple login methods are used with Basware Access. Values supported by Access: 'EmailAndPwd', 'SSO1', (empty).
When field needs to be used, applicable login method code(s) are provided by Basware SaaS production -personnel. When field empty, uses default value (which is configured by SaaS production).

accessTimeout.description: Used only when loginType = 4 (=Basware Access). User specific session idle timeout in seconds to use instead of the login method default. Determines how long user can stay logged in without using the system.

mfa.description: Used only when loginType = 4 (=Basware Access). Determines Multi Factor Authentication settings (additional authentication using SMS or Google authenticator app for smartphones): required, allowed or disabled.

sendAccountCreationEmail.description: Used only when loginType = 4 (=Basware Access). Use 'welcome' if Basware Access should send welcome email containing a link for account activation. The password within the welcome email expires within an hour and can be recovered using 'forgot password' -function. Use 'notSend' if customer wants to send welcome email themselves or if welcome email is not required. ResetPwd is reserved for internal API usage.

accountCreationURI.description: Used only when loginType = 4 (=Basware Access). Defines service address for welcome email sent by Basware Access. Put here the login URL of the service where you want the user to land (P2P, network, etc). In P2P case this is the URL that consultant would give for customer when using SSO login.

companyCode.description: The company code specifies the user's home organization element. Note: The company to which a user is imported needs to be set up as an administrative site in P2P.

loginAllowed.description: Determines whether the user can access the system after the user details are saved. If field is omitted, it is treated as 'false'.

applicationGroups.description: Used for assigning the user to application groups, which give the user login-access to specific applications (P2P, Reporting, Supplier Portal, etc). The applications belonging to each applicationGroup are maintained through applicationGroups API. Value(s) posted need to match to applicationGroupCodes created in applicationGroups API. Application group needs to be created before posting user to API. If no applicationGroups are specified, user will receive those applicationGroups where 'default' = 'true'.

externalCode.description: Unique identifier in P2P and in Basware Access. Change to external code means a new user. The externalCode is ignored by Network Portal, which uses loginAccount as unique identifier.

lastUpdated.description: Timestamp when the record was last sent to API. Set automatically.

uiLanguage.description: Language code. Specifies the language in which the user uses the system. The languages, for example English or Finnish, are available in the language picker.

countryCode.description: Specifies user's country code. Not used in P2P Alusta.

With SSO loginAccount needs to match to the data that identity provider sends to Basware and with P2P basic authentication the loginAccount needs to match to what user keys in during authentication. For example BASWARE\john.smith or john.smith@basware.com. Basware Access basic authentication uses email instead of loginAccount. P2P and Access allow changes to loginAccount without creating a new user, but in Network Portal loginAccount is unique identifier i.e. changed loginAccount means new user into Network Portal.

middleInitial.description: Specifies the user's middle name's initial letter.

email.description: Specifies the users email address. User needs access to the email account in order to set password. Note: When loginType = 4 (Basware Access), the email is used as users login account and must be unique within a tenant. Else only the first user having the same email is accepted, next users are not created.

validFrom.description: The user is active and can use the system starting from this date.

validUntil.description: On this date, the user is deactivated and can no longer use the system.

supervisorLoginAccount.description: Unique user id of the users supervisor.

personCode.description: Defines the users person code that is mapped with the users employee ID.

lastUpdated.description: Timestamp when the record was last sent to API. Set automatically.

externalGroupCode.description: Specifies the user group to which the user gets assigned. Needs to match with 'External code' of User group in P2P user groups administration UI.

active.description: Specifies is the user group active. Note: P2P allows a delete/insert -import of user groups by enabling setting: "P2P Administration" -> "Settings" -> "Delete existing user groups when importing users".

identifier1.description: Identifier1-5: Specifies invoice recipient group(s), to which the user belongs.

UserRecipientIdentifiers.description: Recipient identifier data in P2P. Can be used for specifying invoice recipient groups. Note: User recipient identifiers in P2P are overridden with values received through API. When no values are specified in API, the fields are emptied in P2P.

name.description: Name of Supplier additional data key field.

value.description: Value for key field specified above.

groupName.description: Group name. Not used in P2P.

externalCode.description: External code for vendor address.

name.description: Specifies the address' name for the vendor.

addressType.description: Specifies type of the address. Typically PostalAddress and DeliveryAddress are used with P2P. Types supported by P2P: PostalAddress, DeliveryAddress, AdditionalAddress, RemittanceAddress.

addressLine1.description: Vendor address as free text, line 1. Use by target systems - P2P: no, Vendor manager: yes.

addressLine2.description: Vendor address as free text, line 2. Use by target systems - P2P: no, Vendor manager: yes.

addressLine3.description: Vendor address as free text, line 3. Use by target systems - P2P: no, Vendor manager: yes.

locality.description: Attribute to postalAddress. This field is required in UK if a similar road name exists within a post town area.

countryId.description: Defines the country ID for the account. Please use 2-char ISO country codes (according to ISO-3166-1 -standard). Note: This field is not used in P2P.

default.description: Is this the default address (true / false).

additionalAddressFields.description: Additional address fields. Use by target systems - P2P: yes, Vendor manager: no.

externalCode.description: Specifies a unique code to identify vendor for updates through Basware API.

vendorCode.description: Vendor code to be selected by user onto invoice. Normally the vendor code used by Customer ERP system.

companies.description: List of company units to associate vendor to P2P organization hierarchy

vendorParent.description: VendorCode of parent. Not used in P2P Alusta.

buvid.description: Vendor identifier generated by Basware. Not to be included when posting data.

sourceSystem.description: Name of the source system, e.g. ERP instance

lastUpdated.description: Timestamp when the record was last sent to API. Set automatically.

eligibleForSourcing.description: Specifies whether the vendor is eligible for sourcing activities. This flag can be used to mark vendors that need to be copied to an external sourcing system. Note: If your sourcing system does not support a multiple company -structure, please make sure only one company-specific instance of the each vendor has eligibleForSourcing = 'true'.

vendorClass.description: Specifies vendor class. Can be used to determine preferred vendors in P2P Purchase. Values are determined by customer. Typical example values: A, B, C, Preferred. Note: Allowed values for vendor class need to be configured in P2P before posting data.

contacts.description: Vendor contacts. Used in Vendor Manager. Not used in P2P Alusta, except for email address -field.

tags.description: Tags are used to group the vendors. Not used in P2P.

customFields.description: Custom fields are used to provide additional data. Posted as Supplier additional data -fields to P2P.

companyCode.description: Specifies the organization that the vendor is mapped to.

inheritToChildUnits.description: Specifies whether the vendor is inherited to lower organizations.

name.description: Name of the contact. Used as a key in list of contacts. Note: Max length 50 chars if vendors are imported to ScanMarket.

description.example: Use this as a primary contact

email.description: Specifies the vendor's email address. Field is imported to P2P.

website.description: Specifies the vendor's web site address.

deliveryTermCode.description: Specifies the vendor's delivery term code.

deliveryLocation.description: Specifies delivery location to be used with delivery term selected on order sent to vendor from P2P Purchase.

externalCode.description: Specifies a unique code to identify vendor for updates through Basware API.

vendorCode.description: Vendor code. Normally the vendor code used by Customer ERP system.

vendorParent.description: VendorCode of parent. Not used in P2P Alusta.

buvid.description: Vendor identifier generated by Basware. Not to be included when posting data.

sourceSystem.description: Name of the source system, e.g. ERP instance

lastUpdated.description: Timestamp when the record was last sent to API. Set automatically.

eligibleForSourcing.description: Specifies whether the vendor is eligible for sourcing activities. This flag can be used to mark vendors that need to be copied to an external sourcing system. Note: If your sourcing system does not support a multiple company -structure, please make sure only one company-specific instance of the each vendor has eligibleForSourcing = 'true'.

vendorClass.description: Specifies vendor class. Can be used to determine preferred vendors in P2P Purchase. Values are determined by customer. Typical example values: A, B, C, Preferred. Note: Allowed values for vendor class need to be configured in P2P before posting data.

contacts.description: Vendor contacts. Used in Vendor Manager. Not used in P2P Alusta, except for email address -field.

tags.description: Tags are used to group the vendors. Not used in P2P.

customFields.description: Custom fields are used to provide additional data. Posted as Supplier additional data -fields to P2P.

companies.description: List of company units to associate vendor to P2P organization hierarchy

id.description: Value of the identifier type specified by 'schemeId'.

schemeId.description: Specifies identifier type. Typically used for eInvoicing address, VAT ID, local registry id, DUNS, GLN, etc. Configure available values in P2P. Available values are the supplier identifier keys configured in P2P "identifier configuration". For example 'PartyId' is commonly used for supplier's eInvoicing address.

defaultPartyId.description: Is this the default identifier: true / false.

orderingFormat.description:
Specifies format in which orders are sent to vendor (from P2P Purchase).
'UBL' = Deprecated value, will be converted to 'BaswareNetwork'.
'EHFXML21' = Deprecated value, will be converted to 'BaswareNetwork'.
'email' = Deliver purchase orders by email as PDF attachments or SmartOrders.
'other' = Deprecated value, will be converted to 'none'.
'none' = Vendor not available for purchasing process.
'BaswareNetwork' = Deliver purchase orders in XML UBL2.0 format to Basware Network. 

Note: Since all ERP systems do not have a field for this information, P2P can be configured so that this field is maintained in P2P instead of being imported through API.

orderingMessageLanguage.description: Specifies language of order -message sent to vendor from P2P Purchase.

orderingLanguage.description: Specifies region-specific texts, including number- and date formats used in the order -message sent to supplier from P2P Purchase.

orderEmail.description: Specifies the supplier's email address where the purchase order is sent to. Note: Since all ERP systems do not have a field for this information, P2P can be configured so that this field is maintained in P2P instead of being imported through API.

orderProcessType.description: Name of order process. Not used in P2P Alusta.

minimumOrderAllowed.description: Value of the minimum order allowed. Not used in P2P Alusta.

isTaxable.description: Are purchases from this vendor taxable. Not used in P2P Alusta.

currencyCode.description: Specifies vendor default currency. This is used as vendor's default currency in P2P. Notes: 1) currencyCode of the payment means -block where default = 'true' is selected as the vendor's default currency in P2P. 2) This currency needs to be marked as 'active' in P2P.

default.description: Is this the default payment means (true / false).

paymentTermCode.description: Specifies the vendor's payment term code

active.description: Is the vendor active : true / false.

paymentDenied.description: Is payment block is enabled for the vendor: true / false.

name.description: Name of the tag. Used as key in this array.

Bearer.description: Please insert basic authentication credentials into fields
